title: In-class_Ex02
text:
Importing Geospatial






Your turn



Using the steps you had learned, import the LGA boundary GIS data of Nigeria downloaded from both sources recommended above.



The geoBoundaries data set

#| code fold: true

#| code-summary: "Show the code"

geoNGA <- st_read("data/geospatial/",
                  layer =
                    "geoBoundaries-NGA-ADM2") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 26392)

Reading layer `geoBoundaries-NGA-ADM2' from data source 
  `C:\michellefaithl\is415-gaa-michellefaith\In-class_Ex\In-class_ex02\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 774 features and 6 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2.668534 ymin: 4.273007 xmax: 14.67882 ymax: 13.89442
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84

title: in-class_ex03: Analytical Mapping
text:
Choropleth Map for Rates

Deriving Proportion of Functional Water Points and Non-Functional Water Points

NGA_wp <- NGA_wp %>%
  mutate(pct_functional = wp_functional/total_wp) %>%
  mutate(pct_nonfunctional = wp_nonfunctional/total_wp)



Plotting map of rate
Plot a choropleth map showing the distribution of percentage functional water point by LGA

tm_shape(NGA_wp) +
  tm_fill("pct_functional",
          n=10,
          style = "equal",
          palette = "Blues",
          legend.hist = TRUE) +
  tm_borders(lwd = 0.1,
             alpha = 1) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Rate map of functional water point by LGAs",
            legend.outside = TRUE)
